camera_ros module

class camera_ros.CameraComponent(ros_handler: RosHandler, display_rect=(20, 20, 640, 360), instant_switching=True, preload_all=False)[source]

Bases: object

Interfaces with the centralised RosHandler to display ROS2 camera feeds from multiple image topics published by the drones. Supports instant switching between camera topics using preloading or subscribe-unsubscribe methods.

Camera feeds is then displayed in a defined rectangle on the Pygame screen GUI.

cleanup()[source]

Resource cleanup through unsubscribing from all subscribed camera topics

cycle_drone_camera(current_drone_index: int, num_drones: int, direction: int)[source]

Cycle through drone front cameras without returning/updating drone selection.

Used with rs1_teensyjoy controller switch camera buttons.

Args:

  • current_drone_index (int): Current drone index (0-based, -1 if none selected)

  • num_drones (int): Total number of drones

  • direction (int): 1 for next, -1 for previous

draw(screen)[source]

Draws the camera feed onto the given Pygame screen surface within the defined display rectangle

get_current_topic() → str | None[source]

Gets the name of the currently displayed camera topic if any is presently selected.

Returns:

  • str or None: Name of the current camera topic, or None if no topic is selected.

get_status_info() → str[source]

Outputs the display status info, whether ROS2 is available, if there are camera topics. Also checks the camera topic status, i.e. LIVE if topic is active, or STALE if inactive.

Returns:

  • str: Display Status Message depending on status check.

handle_keypress(key)[source]

Handle keypress events for camera switching. When the ‘C’ key is pressed, the camera topic switches to the next available camera topic if any.

switch_to_drone_camera(drone_id: int, camera_type: str = 'front') → bool[source]

Switch to a specific drone’s camera.

Args:

  • drone_id (int): Drone number (1, 2, 3, etc.)

  • camera_type (str): “front” or “bottom”

Returns:

  • bool: True if switch was successful, False otherwise.

switch_to_next_topic() → bool[source]

Switch to the next camera topic in the available topics list.

Returns:

  • bool: True if switch was successful, False otherwise.

switch_to_previous_topic() → bool[source]

Switch to the previous camera topic in the available topics list.

Returns:

  • bool: True if switch was successful, False otherwise.

switch_to_topic(topic_index: int) → bool[source]

Switch to a different camera topic by index.

Args:

  • topic_index (int): Index of the topic in available_topics to switch to.

Returns:

  • bool: True if switch was successful, False otherwise.

update()[source]

Updates the camera feed from the RosHandler, using cv2, the camera image is stored which is then converted to a pygame surface using _cv2_to_pygame_surface.
